input: Venus has an exceptionally thick atmosphere, composed primarily of carbon dioxide. Its dense clouds are mainly composed of sulfuric acid droplets. This has caused a phenomenon known as a 'super-greenhouse effect', which has raised the planet's temperature to more than 400 degrees Celsius.
output: Venus has an extremely dense atmosphere composed primarily of carbon dioxide, as well as sulfuric acid droplets in its clouds. This has caused a 'super-greenhouse effect', which has raised the temperature of the planet to over 400 degrees Celsius.
